result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plaintiffs Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by ADA Jordan Lippert
Additional Discovery letter filed by Atty Lippert to Atty Middleton
for failure to appear at the 9/22/22 return date

9:00 AM Defendant Michael Lewis Clark not in court.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II in court for Michael Lewis Clark.  Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Middleton had no information for the court. State requested the bond be forfeited and warrant be issued. Warrant is authorized forthwith. Bond is forfeited. 9:09 AM
Order Allowing Travel to Texas - Defendant failed to appear for hearing

11:09 AM Court called 22CF354.   Defendant Michael Lewis Clark not in court.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II in court for Michael Lewis Clark.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. State requested a warrant. Atty Middleton requested warrant be stayed.  Court ordered warrant forthwith. Adjourned 11:10 AM.
granting defendant's out of state travel to the State of Texas until August 28, 2022 at 11:00 A.M.
Bail/bond hearing on August 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
to Modify Bond filed by Atty Middleton
Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Peter Middleton
for Preservation of Evidence filed by  Atty Peter Middleton
for a pretrial conference 8/30/22 at 9:00 A.M. and return date 9/22/22 at 9:00 A.M.
standard felony conditions,  not possess/consume alcohol, absolute sobriety, absolute sobriety while operating a motor vehicle

1:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Lewis Clark in court in custody by video from the Columbia County Jail. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, $200.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions,  not possess/consume alcohol, absolute sobriety, absolute sobriety while operating a motor vehicle, waives time limits to prelim,
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return date scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
